questions.question_text: An engineer must configure a dial plan tor a new Cisco UCM cluster. Standard local route groups must be used for all local calls. After the route pattern, route list and route groups are configured, which settings must the engineer configure for the standard local route groups?

choices.C: Ensure that the Cisco UCM subscriber node is running.
choices.B: Add an additional NTP server to the Cisco UCM publisher node.
choices.A: Add an additional NTP server on the Cisco UCM subscriber node.
choices.D: Ensure that the Cisco UCM publisher node is up and running.

comments.content: To clarify, subscriber get his clock from the publisher, this is by design. It is FALSE that an additional NTP server can be added to the subscriber.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
If the subscriber has network connectivity and is reaching the NTP, and the NTP is working and running, then the last thing that is needed to review is the publisher.
At least Publisher and subscriber must be reachable each other, whether they use prefix /30 or /29, so in these conditions, if subscriber reach the NTP, the publisher must do it too. So it is needed to check what happen with publisher.
Definitely D

Selected Answer: D
Definitely D.

CUCM publisher needs an NTP source that is not a member of the CUCM cluster; therefore the CUCM publisher synchronizes its time with the NTP server. In this exchange, the CUCM publisher is an NTP client.

The CUCM subscribers synchronize their time with the CUCM publisher. In this exchange, the CUCM publisher is an NTP server where the CUCM subscribers are NTP clients.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/unified-communications/unified-communications-manager-callmanager/215537-network-time-protocol-ntp-on-cucm.html

.INIT. means that initialization has not yet succeeded.
Probable causes of NTP issues in CUCM:
- External NTP server is not reachable.
- NTP stratum is higher than the acceptable limit.
- Publisher is down, so the Subscriber NTP is unsynchronized.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/unified-communications/unified-communications-manager-callmanager/118718-technote-cucm-00.html

Selected Answer: D
D is correct

comments.content: correction I think it is A. the subscriber can receive NTP info from the NTP server directly. instead of depending on the PUB.
As far as I know, it is not possible. If you share the reference that support what you are claiming, it would be very grateful.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
I think the issue is with the PUB.

adding an additional NTP server wouldn't affect the current setup since the node must be added to both and it is reachable by the SUB.

Selected Answer: A
It is A

Selected Answer: A
Ad hoc conference calls can be dropped when the originator hangs up. This is achieved by setting the Drop Ad Hoc Conference service parameter to When Conference Controller Leaves under Clusterwide Parameters > Feature > Conference. This ensures that the other parties (such as external users) cannot initiate a call to another external number.

Selected Answer: A
It's A
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/admin/10_5_2/ccmfeat/CUCM_BK_C3A84B33_00_cucm-feature-configuration-guide_1052/CUCM_BK_C3A84B33_00_cucm-feature-configuration-guide_chapter_010000.html

comments.content:
I disagree. Because if you are (restricting users from creating ad hoc conferences), it means that CTO or Even CEO will not be allowed to create a conference.. that does not make sense..you do not completely Disable a feature.. 

Answer is : A

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The correct answer is C. The parameter that needs to be adjusted is Restrict Ad Hoc Conference.

Restrict Ad Hoc Conference is a parameter in Cisco Unified Communications Manager that allows administrators to restrict users from creating ad hoc conferences. When this parameter is set to "On," users are not able to create ad hoc conferences. This can help prevent situations like the one described in the question, where an external user is added to a conference call and stays on after the host leaves, potentially causing unauthorized charges.

Drop Ad Hoc Conference is a related parameter that determines what happens when an ad hoc conference is dropped by the host or when all participants leave the conference. Limit Ad Hoc Conference is a parameter that determines the maximum number of participants that can join an ad hoc conference. Monitor Ad Hoc Conference is a parameter that determines whether or not ad hoc conferences are monitored for quality of service.

questions.question_text: During a conference call, the CTO of a company adds an external user to the call. The CTO leaves at the end of the call, but the external user stays on and dials out to a premium rate number. Several weeks later, the CTO receives an unexpectedly nigh phone bill. The CTO decides to implement an Ad Hoc conference restriction. Which parameters must be adjusted?

//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer deploys this Cisco Unified Border Element configuration, but the phone at extension 2221 fails to ring. These configurations were performed already in Cisco UCM:

//IMG//
• phone configuration and registration
• SIP trunk configuration
• translation pattern configuration

Which action resolves the issue?

choices.C: Apply voice translation-rule 3 to dial-peer 10 voip.
choices.D: Replace voice translation-rule 3 with voice translation-rule 1.
choices.A: Apply voice translation-rule 3 to dial-peer 11 voip.
choices.B: Change the destination pattern for dial-peer voice 10 to 2... $.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
A., C., and D. are incorrect. You can not apply directly a translation rule to the dial peer. Instead, you must apply in the dial-peer 10 "translation-profile outgoing profile1".
B. is correct since the destination pattern is specifying the last 4 digits of the called number with the $ symbol, so it will match the number 2221 of the entire number 555-555-2221.

comments.content:
Now, another consideration. If you dial 555-555-2221, the dial-peer, if you fixed it to 2...$, even the dial-peer will not match the number 555-555-2221
However, the question says that there is already a translation profile in the CUCM, I assume that the translation profile must be something like that 555555.2221 and discard digits pre-dot, and then the new called number sent to the CUBA, must match the dial-peer 10. In these condiciones, answer B continues being the correct answer

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Check session target
It can be both. C and A.
C. Apply voice translation-rule 3 to dial-peer 10 voip.

Selected Answer: C
the correct answer is C

Selected Answer: A
A is presumably the correct answer, but you can't actually apply a translation-rule to a dial-peer. You have to apply a translation-PROFILE, which then references the translation-rule. i.e. it needs "translation-profile incoming profile1" added to dial-peer 11.

Presumably that's what they mean with A here.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct,

I think answer A "Apply voice translation-rule 3 to dial-peer 11 voip" is correct. vt-rule3 will strip called prefixed 555-555 and does keep 2221. Remaining 2221 does then match destination pattern ....$ of dp voice 10 voip => to CUCM

questions.question_text: How does an administrator ensure compliance with ITU-T G.114 latency requirements when deploying voice and video applications over routes that include a geostationary satellite?

discussion.content:
"
For satellite circuits, the expected latency can be in the range of 250 to 900 ms. For example, signals being relayed via geostationary satellites will need to be sent to an altitude of 35,786 km (22,236 miles) above sea level (from the equator) out into space and then back to Earth again. There is nothing an administrator can do to decrease latency in such scenarios because they can do nothing about increasing the speed of light or radio waves. All that can be done to address the effect of latency in these scenarios is to educate the user-base so that realistic performance expectations are set.
"
C

comments.content:
But in Cisco Guide is not explained 
"The satellite is 35,786 km (22,236 miles) above sea level (from the equator)" :-)
That question should confuse by text length?
150ms is the key answer...

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/cucm/srnd/collab11/collab11/netstruc.html

choices.A: For voice and video applications over satellite, Cisco recommends using WAN optimization compression, which will save space or time of the transmission. The latency will then be below the recommended latency threshold for voice.
choices.D: The application will work because it will be below the recommenced latency requirement If an engineer uses compressed headers to speed up the voice packets.
choices.B: Using G.729 voice codec Instead of G.711 voice codec will reduce the packet size and the latency to stay within the recommended threshold.
choices.C: The satellite is 35,786 km (22,236 miles) above sea level (from the equator), so an engineer will not get below 150 ms latency in one direction and will need to manage the expectation of the user.
